result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.

State is in agreement.

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on August 23, 2022 at 10:20 am.

Jury Trial on November 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Robin M Zdziebowski
Current: 202 Grand Ave. Apt. B, Wausau, WI 54403 United States  (Effective: 06-14-2022)
Prior: 911 1/2 Washington St, Wausau, WI 54403

No contact with victim(s): Family Dollar on Grand Avenue in Wausau.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

3:03 PM 
Clerk: Amy. 

State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen.   Defendant appears in person, with Atty Peter Vu. 

Date and time set for initial appearance. 
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
PLEA: Not guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: $250.00 signature bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): Family Dollar on Grand Avenue in Wausau.  
- Prints and photograph. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
